title: ProMedica Hospice Serving Northeast Ohio - ProMedica Hospice

content.counties: Medina, Portage, Stark, Summit
content.title: Hospice Doesn’t Mean Giving Up Hope
content.description: We provide care wherever you call home: in your house, a skilled nursing center, an assisted living facility or independent living facility. Our caregivers help create individualized care plans, set personal goals, and manage pain and symptoms. Every patient is different. With different challenges, different needs, different family and friends. So the care we give each patient is different.

enrichingLife.content: We believe wholeheartedly in the power of the individual, the importance of relationships and the value of respect and dignity to everyone at every stage of life. Our goal is to create a positive difference every day, to make a personal connection and to create memorable moments that will enrich your life.

patientServices.content: Pain and symptom management is our primary focus. Our caring, interdisciplinary staff also provides psychosocial and spiritual support along with other comforting treatments and therapies.

familySupport.content: Caring for a loved one is one of the most significant challenges life can present. We're here for you, too. Whether it’s to get your thoughts about what your loved one needs or to have a safe space to share your feelings.

memorialFund.content: The ProMedica Hospice Memorial Fund, formerly Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund, assists those who are coping with terminal illness, death and the process of grief and bereavement. It also supports services and education related to hospice care.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEART ATTACK SURVIVOR CONTINUES TO SHARE HER STORY
testimonials.quote: Mia, Account Liaison, continues to share her story to help educate women on the risks of heart disease and what to look for in the case of a heart attack.

testimonials.quoteTitle: DIRECTOR OF BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT EXPLAINS THE IMPORTANCE OF HOSPICE CARE

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE PATIENT HEARS EMPOWERING MESSAGES FROM HIS FAVORITE STAR TREK ACTORS
testimonials.quote: Julie Moores, Regional Manager of Business Development, recently received upsetting news that her best friend for several decades, Mike’s, cancer had returned. She helped him with receiving hospice services and knew her Heartland Hospice serving Southwest Ohio team would take amazing care of him during this difficult time. While discussing life, the difficulties of the past year and the recent devastating news about Mike’s health, Julie wanted to do something extra special for her friend and something she knew would fulfill one of Mike’s life-long dreams.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE VOLUNTEER WITH A PASSION FOR VETERANS MAKES UNIQUE USE OF PANDEMIC VOLUNTEER TIME
testimonials.quote: COVID-19 restrictions derailed Chris’s volunteer service plans for many months since many hospice patients could not receive visitors. Instead, Chris took on a significant project – making a directory of all Wisconsin war memorials to share with Heartland Hospice employees, patients and families.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE TEAM HELPS CELEBRATE 102ND BIRTHDAY OF AMERICAN LEGION
testimonials.quote: Recognizing and honoring veterans at the end-of-life is an integral part of our hospice care. Heartland Home Health and Hospice serving Northeastern Wisconsin joined members from The American Legion Post 63 Veterans Memorial in Clintonville, WI to celebrate the 102nd birthday of the American Legion.

He was smiling as he read it. Eugene was grinning from ear to ear and said, ‘Thank you. This means a lot to a lonely man like me.’”

testimonials.quote: "Working with Ashlee has been a joy and having her engaged in my father's hospice care has provided me with comfort and peace of mind."

testimonials.quote: Heartland Hospice serving Raleigh-Durham continues to help fulfill their patients' last wishes. Kristin Lassiter, spiritual care coordinator, and Annie Rankin, care transitions nurse, had the honor of helping a lovely couple celebrate their special love for each other.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE TEAM JUMPS INTO ACTION TO HONOR VETERAN PATIENT AT END-OF-LIFE
testimonials.quote: Michelle, bereavement coordinator and Matt, account liaison, with Heartland Hospice serving Raleigh-Durham had the privilege of participating in a pinning ceremony for veteran patient, Jonathan Gorman.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE BEREAVEMENT TEAM HOSTS DRIVE-THRU MEMORIAL EVENTS DURING CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC
testimonials.quote: Heartland Hospice serving Raleigh-Durham was faced with challenges this year when it came to planning their annual memorial service. However, instead of the typical in-person service that is held each year, the team was able to plan several events that ensured the participants would stay safe.

testimonials.quoteTitle: SPIRITUAL CARE: AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE JOURNEY FOR MANY HOSPICE PATIENTS AND FAMILIES
testimonials.quote: Kinsley Lewis-Cobb, Spiritual Care Coordinator for Heartland Hospice serving Raleigh-Durham, shares her thoughts on what it means to be a Spiritual Care Coordinator and tells a wonderful story about how spiritual care provided comfort for a recent patient’s family.

testimonials.quoteTitle: SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT OF PROMEDICA SKILLED NURSING AND REHABILITATION THANKFUL FOR SUPPORT OF HOSPICE TEAM

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE TEAM AMAZED BY COMMUNITY SUPPORT DURING HOLIDAYS
testimonials.quote: Community crafters have gone above and beyond for Heartland Hospice serving Greater Reading patients. Artists, members of the business community, retirees, Boy Scouts and many others channeled their creativity and made nearly 300 decorations for our hospice patients who live in skilled nursing facilities. Lori Gourama, volunteer coordinator, details the support Heartland received from the Greater Reading community.

testimonials.quoteTitle: VETERAN HOSPICE PATIENT REMEMBERS "THE WAY IT WAS"
testimonials.quote: Edward Mull, Heartland Hospice patient and Purple Heart recipient, recalls stories and incidents from WWII as he celebrates his 99th birthday.

One such opportunity arose recently when a patient, Barb, began improving enough to express herself verbally after several months.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE TEAM CELEBRATES NEW NAME AND NATIONAL HOSPICE AND PALLIATIVE CARE MONTH
testimonials.quote: This past November, ProMedica Hospice Serving North Central Illinois and Southern Wisconsin (previously Heartland Hospice) held a ribbon-cutting event to celebrate both its new name and National Hospice and Palliative Care Month.

testimonials.quoteTitle: EACH INDIVIDUAL VETERAN'S STORY MATTERS!
testimonials.quote: Tracy Rosinski, regional veteran liaison for ProMedica Home Health and Hospice agencies in Wisconsin and Northern Illinois, tells her story about a conversation she had with a veteran that helped her realize it is important to have a specific intention behind each "thank you".

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE SPIRITUAL CARE COORDINATOR VISITS PATIENTS THROUGH WINDOWS

Pieter knew he needed to get creative, so he decided he would conduct his visits through a window wherever he could.

testimonials.quote: Every day, Heartland Hospice receives thanks for the care they have provided to a patient or someone’s loved one. Many say they don’t have the words to describe their appreciation and simply say “Thanks.” Heartland Hospice Serving Northern Michigan recently received a wonderful thank you letter from Phil, the husband of a patient.

testimonials.quoteTitle: DAUGHTER EXPRESSES IMMENSE GRATITUDE TO HEARTLAND HOSPICE TEAM
testimonials.quote: "I want to express our immense gratitude for making it possible for the ending of my mother's life to be spent here at home with me, with all the comfort and peace of mind that only being home provides."

title: ProMedica Hospice Serving Chicagoland Central - ProMedica Hospice

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE MUSIC THERAPIST CONTINUES TO CONNECT WITH PATIENTS DURING DIFFICULT TIMES
testimonials.quote: Heartland Hospice Serving Chicagoland Central is finding unique ways to stay connected to patients during this time. Amber Price, Music Therapist with Heartland Hospice, shared her experience of connecting through music following the restrictions to visit with her patients.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE AND ARDEN COURTS GRANT PATIENT'S WISH TO BE HOME
testimonials.quote: Arden Courts and Heartland Hospice reassured the patient and his wife that he would be safely transported home. They were both happy when he made it home safely to be together again for his last wish.

testimonials.quoteTitle: VETERAN RECOGNITION CEREMONY HELD BY HEARTLAND HOSPICE AND ARDEN COURTS
testimonials.quote: This Veteran’s Day, Heartland Hospice and Arden Courts of Glen Ellyn co-hosted a “We Honor Veterans” recognition ceremony for all of the veteran residents.

testimonials.quoteTitle: VETERANS HONORED BY HEARTLAND HOSPICE AND ARDEN COURTS OF GENEVA
testimonials.quote: Dorothy Lemke Rothwell, at 90, doesn't remember as much about her time in the Army as she used to. "That was a long time ago," she said. But she remembers enough to tear up when beginning to talk about that time in her life.

testimonials.quote: "I just want all of ProMedica, ProMedica Palliative Care and ProMedica Hospice Serving Wichita, to know the care that was delivered meant so much to our family. We are thankful for everyone that was involved in his care."

testimonials.quoteTitle: MOTHER AND DAUGHTER THANKFUL FOR HOME HEALTH AND HOSPICE CARE TEAMS
testimonials.quote: "It’s great that Heartland offers both home health and hospice care within one agency. Heartland has done a phenomenal job."

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE SERVING WICHITA PROVIDES LAUGHS AND SMILES WITH DANCING UNICORN
testimonials.quote: "A little silliness and laughter goes a long way. I know from my experience, Heartland Hospice always goes the extra mile and I’m so happy that everyone enjoyed seeing that."

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE DONATES TO COMMUNITY MEMBER IN NEED
testimonials.quote: A student at Enterprise Elementary School now has two walkers thanks to a little help from his school nurse, teacher and the community. Heartland Hospice serving Wichita donated one of the walkers to the young student with MS to help him get around school easier.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE SERVING SOUTH JERSEY ATTENDS FIRST RESPONDER PARADE
testimonials.quote: Heartland Hospice Serving South Jersey attended the first responder parade held at Inspira Medical Center – Mullica Hill in New Jersey. The Harrison Fire Department planned the event and invited Heartland Hospice to join in on the celebration.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE HONORS AND THANKS NURSES DURING NURSES WEEK
testimonials.quote: The agencies made thank you signs and brightened sidewalks with artwork, thank yous and words of encouragement to thank the nurses and to bring cheer to those coming into work at many facilities the agencies work closely with.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HEARTLAND HOSPICE HONORS FIRST RESPONDERS DURING PANDEMIC
testimonials.quote: Along with health care workers, Heartland Hospice Serving South Jersey wanted to ensure their local first responders knew how much they’re appreciated during this time.

testimonials.quoteTitle: PROMEDICA HOSPICE BEREAVEMENT COORDINATOR CO-LEADS VETERAN COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP
testimonials.quote: Kevin Cross, bereavement coordinator at ProMedica Hospice serving South Central Pennsylvania, along with Doug Etter, chief communication officer with Lebanon VA Medical Center, came together to become co-chairs of the Lebanon, PA Veterans Community Partnership (VCP). VCP primarily focuses on hospice and palliative care and making veteran patients comfortable during their end of life.

testimonials.quote: The free bereavement day camp features therapeutic activities, arts and crafts and team building exercises led by a team of professional counselors, hospice team members and trained volunteers. Children explore issues related to the impact that loss can have on their lives in a safe and supportive atmosphere.

testimonials.quote: ProMedica Hospice serving Monroe and Lenawee Counties is fortunate to have over 50 volunteers who provide support in various ways to patients at end-of-life. content.counties: Blue Earth, Brown, Faribault, Freeborn, Le Sueur, Martin, Nicollet, Rice, Sibley, Steele, Waseca, Watonwan
content.title: Hospice Doesn’t Mean Giving Up Hope
content.description: We provide care wherever you call home: in your house, a skilled nursing center, an assisted living facility or independent living facility. Our caregivers help create individualized care plans, set personal goals, and manage pain and symptoms. Every patient is different. With different challenges, different needs, different family and friends. So the care we give each patient is different.

enrichingLife.content: We believe wholeheartedly in the power of the individual, the importance of relationships and the value of respect and dignity to everyone at every stage of life. Our goal is to create a positive difference every day, to make a personal connection and to create memorable moments that will enrich your life.

patientServices.content: Pain and symptom management is our primary focus. Our caring, interdisciplinary staff also provides psychosocial and spiritual support along with other comforting treatments and therapies.

familySupport.content: Caring for a loved one is one of the most significant challenges life can present. We're here for you, too. Whether it’s to get your thoughts about what your loved one needs or to have a safe space to share your feelings.

memorialFund.content: The ProMedica Hospice Memorial Fund, formerly Heartland Hospice Memorial Fund, assists those who are coping with terminal illness, death and the process of grief and bereavement. It also supports services and education related to hospice care.

testimonials.quoteTitle: HOSPICE TEAM ADOPTS A HIGHWAY IN THEIR COMMUNITY
testimonials.quote: Heartland Hospice serving South Central Minnesota, recently adopted a highway in their area. As part of adopting a highway, the Heartland team cleans up the area along the highway twice a year and can display their name on the “Adopt-a-Highway” sign.

testimonials.quoteTitle: DAUGHTER THANKFUL FOR THE HOSPICE CARE PROVIDED TO HER FATHER
testimonials.quote: Rumi was grateful for the care provided to her father. Little did she know that Heartland Hospice was also grateful for her.

testimonials.quote: Heartland Hospice serving Tide Water teamed up with the local community to help a hospice patient and her family.

testimonials.quoteTitle: NURSE PRACTITIONER THANKFUL FOR HEARTLAND HOSPICE
testimonials.quote: "I’m honored to work with such amazing individuals who are so dedicated to their calling in life – a higher quality of care.”

testimonials.quoteTitle: BEING THERE FOR OUR PATIENTS
testimonials.quote: Tina McDaniel, RN Case Manager for Heartland Hospice serving Augusta had an experience that reminded her how plans can change and the privilege of being there with her patients as they near their end-of-life journey.
